name: Barbecue: Burnt Ends
description: A while back, my partner in barbecue crime here at SE, James Boo, wrote an amazing piece on burnt ends, and why they're so delicious. Though it already thoroughly covers their history and role in this world, I'll just tell you that they're so good, you'll want more than just the few trimmed off a whole smoked brisket. Luckily, there's an easy solution to that.
recipeIngredient: 1 freshly smoked brisket point, separated from flat if cooked whole
1 cup your favorite barbecue sauce, plus more for serving
1/2 cup drippings from smoked brisket, if reserved

recipeInstructions.text: Cut smoked brisket point into 1/2-inch cubes and place in a large disposable tray. Add in 1 cup of barbecue and brisket drippings, if reserved, and toss to thoroughly coat brisket pieces.
Place tray back in smoker and smoke at 225 degrees until brisket pieces darken and become crisp around the edges, 2 to 4 hours.
Remove from smoker, let cool for 10 minutes, then serve, with additional barbecue sauce, if desired.
